titles.title: Meitantei Conan: 16 Nin no Yougisha
Detective Conan: 16 Suspects
Detective Conan OVA 2
المحقق كونان: المشتبه بهم الستة عشر
Детектив Конан: 16 заподозряни
名探偵コナン 16人の容疑者!?

relatedanime.anime: Meitantei Conan: Conan to Heiji to Kieta Shounen
Meitantei Conan: Conan vs Kid vs Yaiba

anime.description: The detective boys, the Mouri family, Professor http://anidb.net/ch8164 [Agasa], http://anidb.net/ch8178 [Heiji], http://anidb.net/ch8170 [Sonoko], http://anidb.net/ch8173 [Kazuha], and several members of the police are invited to Inspector http://anidb.net/ch8184 [Shiratori]`s party at Karuizawa. An incident occurs, and now there are 16 suspects among those invited to the party. Source: ANN

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: precocious
tag.description: Exhibiting mature qualities at an unusually early age, especially in mental aptitude.

tag.name: prodigy
tag.description: Character is very good at everything he/she does.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: countryside
tag.description: The anime takes place far from the any densely populated areas like cities, i.e. out in the suburbs, in the countryside with many fields and forests.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: alcohol
tag.description: Alcohol (or more scientifically, ethanol), is one of the world`s oldest psychoactive substances. It is traditionally found in the form of a beverage such as beer, wine, or liquor, although in some contexts it can be inhaled to produce similar or intoxication, and some people prefer another way of consuming beverage-form alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are many and varied, due to production methods (fermentation or distillation), source materials (grains, fruits, vegetables, other plants), added substances such as flavorings, and many more ways of defining different forms of alcoholic beverages. Alcoholic beverages are divided into three general classes: beers, wines, and spirits. They are legally consumed in most countries, and over 100 countries have laws regulating their production, sale, and consumption. In particular, such laws specify the minimum age at which a person may legally buy or drink them. This minimum age varies between 16 and 25 years, depending upon the country and the type of drink. Most nations set it at 18 years of age.

tag.name: karaoke
tag.description: Obligatory national pastime for students in any anime with school setting. Amateur singing to subtitled music videos. The word itself is a compound of the Japanese words for "empty orchestra".

tag.name: real-world location
tag.description: Places seen in the show exist in reality. Note: This could be sometime in the future, though names and certain places will still be recognizable.

tag.name: grandiose displays of wealth
tag.description: Some of the characters in this anime come from very wealthy families. A huge estate with large mansion or castle, a flotilla of expensive cars, private jets or islands, and many servants will impress the viewer profoundly.

tag.name: trapped in the body of a child
tag.description: For some reason, a character in this anime who is a late-teenager or an adult, has their mind trapped in the body of a child. E.g. a former late teenager or an adult is transformed into a child. This can be the result of magic, science, or otherwise.

tag.name: police are useless
tag.description: The civilian law enforcement representatives do not seem to be of much use, when trying to take on the usually vastly superior foes. The "helpless" and often clumsy antics of the police can be used as a comedy element.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: Sherlock Holmes
tag.description: Fictional London-based detective created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

tag.name: adults are useless
tag.description: For when adults can`t do anything right.

tag.name: secret identity
tag.description: The (usually main) protagonist has a secret identity that he or she desperately tries to keep secret. This can lead to all sorts of amusing misunderstandings, thus is used as comedy element in some anime.

tag.name: mystery
tag.description: The mystery film is a sub-genre of the more general category of crime film. It focuses on the efforts of the detective, private investigator or amateur sleuth to solve the mysterious circumstances of a crime by means of clues, investigation, and clever deduction. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tales
tag.description: Tales are stories told time and again and passed down from generation to generation, and some of those show up in anime not just once or twice, but several times.

character.name: Mouri Ran
character.description: Mouri Ran is one of the main characters in Detective Conan. She is the daughter of Mouri Kogoro, a famous but lazy detective. She is also friends with Kudo Shinichi, another famous detective, who is still in high school. She is the captain of the high school karate team, and is very strong willed.

character.name: Mouri Kogorou
character.description: Kogorou was once with the police, but due to an incident that involved his wife Eri as well, he quit. Due to the same incident, he and Eri split up. He`s got custody of his daughter Ran who lives with him in an apartment that is at the same time his detective agency, on top of a café named Coffee Poirot. Despite of having been a good policeman, he`s a bad detective - but still very famous. That only comes due to the fact that Conan is "abusing" this adult`s sedated body to deduct his theories for the sake of outing the high amount of murderers whose crimes he solved. Kogorou might be a smoking, drinking, good-for-nothing loudmouth with a high affection to idol Okino Youko, but he still is a good guy when it comes to handling his daughter or wife. Due to Conan having made him famous as the Sleeping Kogorou, he sometimes gets over his head and just believes he`s the big shot everybody else thinks he is. Kogorou finally accepts Conan as a "lodger", when Conan`s "mother" gave him access to an account filled with 10.000.000 Yen (about 90.000€/122.500$). His voice is Number 59 on Conan`s bowtie.

character.name: Agasa Hiroshi
character.description: Agasa Hiroshi is a good friend of Shin`ichi / Conan who invents several devices to help him out, such as the voice changing bowtie or the watch with which Conan can tranquilize people. Note: His name Hiroshi is written with the kanji 博士, which can also be read `Hakase` (Professor)

character.name: Suzuki Sonoko
character.description: Sonoko is Mouri Ran`s best friend and is the girlfriend of http://anidb.net/ch8180 [Kyougoku Makoto]. Source: detectiveconanworld.com

character.name: Kisaki Eri
character.description: Kisaki Eri is Ran`s mother and the ex-wife of her childhood-friend Kogorou. She`s also a famous lawyer. Even though they`re divorced, Eri is still wearing her wedding ring. When asked by Ran about that, she answers that it keeps "other dirty men" away. Ran hopes that her parents will find back together.

character.name: Tooyama Kazuha
character.description: Kazuha is a girl from Osaka. She`s been childhood friends with Heiji, and could be referred to as his girlfriend - even though they`re too shy / childish to admit it already. When she meets Ran for the first time (episode 118) she directly explains to her that Heiji is off limits, and that the girl/woman that wants to get to him has to go through her fast - which makes her either protective or possessive of Heiji. Later on Ran and Kazuha become really good girl friends. Kazuha`s father, like Heiji`s, also works for the Osaka police.

character.name: Takagi Wataru
character.description: Takagi Wataru (named after his voice actor who ad-lipped his own name in a scene) is a police officer from the Investigation Division (1st Division).

character.name: Megure Juuzou
character.description: Inspector Juuzou is a veteran police officer who has been working with http://anidb.net/ch2263 [Kudou Shin`ichi], http://anidb.net/ch8175 [Kudou Yuusaku] and http://anidb.net/ch8163 [Mouri Kogoro]. He always wears his hat to hide an old scar which reminds him of a special case from 20 years ago, during his early police days which involved his wife, http://anidb.net/ch16583 [Midori].
